line_2: Now draws the Plan, or now erects the Pile;

line_1: And crown'd with fame your TORRICELL, and BOYLE;
line_2: IV. 1.  "You charm'd, indulgent SYLPHS! their learnedtoil,

line_1: To teach th' Unknowing, and to please a Boyle.
line_2: Dare to have Taste, and urge thy glorious Toil,

line_1: While some grow pale o'er Newton, Locke, or Boyle,
line_2: Miss reads romances, and my lady Hoyle;

line_1: Reluctant spares thee such a son as BOYLE.
line_2: Guard well thy charge, for know, our polish'd isle
